title: How to Make Lace Pictures

steps.headline: Assemble the things needed.
steps.description: These are listed below. If the lace needs pressing, do so now, on the wrong side.

steps.headline: Cut the cardboard to fit the frame.
Cut the velvet or other fabric.
steps.description: This should be about 2cm (3/4") larger than the cardboard piece.

steps.headline: Arrange the lace piece or pieces onto the velvet background.
steps.description: Try a few positions until you get one that you like the most.

steps.headline: Pin the lace into place using the small pins.
Place the velvet with the lace design over the cardboard piece.
steps.description: Fold the excess over the back of the cardboard and tape it into place firmly. (You could also glue it in place if preferred but tape makes it easier to remove later.) Pull it tightly before taping into place.

steps.headline: Insert the velvet and lace design into the frame.
steps.description: Place another piece of cardboard at the back to serve as the backing against the wall.

steps.headline: Tidy up the whole frame so that it sits straight.
steps.description: It is now ready for hanging or displaying wherever you'd like.

text: Assemble the things needed. These are listed below. If the lace needs pressing, do so now, on the wrong side. Cut the cardboard to fit the frame.  Cut the velvet or other fabric. This should be about 2cm (3/4") larger than the cardboard piece. Arrange the lace piece or pieces onto the velvet background. Try a few positions until you get one that you like the most. Pin the lace into place using the small pins.  Place the velvet with the lace design over the cardboard piece. Fold the excess over the back of the cardboard and tape it into place firmly. (You could also glue it in place if preferred but tape makes it easier to remove later.) Pull it tightly before taping into place. Insert the velvet and lace design into the frame. Place another piece of cardboard at the back to serve as the backing against the wall. Tidy up the whole frame so that it sits straight. It is now ready for hanging or displaying wherever you'd like.
